orchestrator.goal: Produce a PDDL domain and problem that encodes scheduling a 30-minute meeting on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00 so all participants can attend, suitable for the FastDownwards solver.

public_information: Schedule a 30-minute meeting on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00
Time can be aligned to 30-minute slots
There exists at least one feasible time given current schedules

availability.system_prompt: You are Alan. Using your private busy intervals and the public work hours, produce your available 30-minute time slots on Monday as a list of intervals formatted as HH:MM-HH:MM with slots aligned to 30-minute boundaries.
availability.prompt: Provide Alan's free 30-minute slots on Monday given public information and private busy intervals.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert at multi-agent PDDL problem creation and at preparing problems for the FastDownwards solver. You must produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem that encode scheduling a 30-minute meeting on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00 using the received availability profiles. Always enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Use discrete 30-minute time slots and ensure the encoding is compatible with FastDownwards.
pddl.prompt: Integrate the participants' availability profiles and the public information to produce a PDDL domain and problem that schedule one 30-minute meeting on Monday such that all participants can attend. Keep participant roles explicit if needed. Enclose the domain in <domain></domain> and the problem in <problem></problem>.
